units.name: Lattice
units.prompt: Control chokepoints with traps. Place them between enemy positions and your allies. Use denial to block adjacent enemy abilities. Pulse groups when possible.

units.name: Hawk
units.prompt: Stay at maximum range. Use precision_shot on the most wounded enemy to secure kills. If no one is wounded, target the enemy medic. Never move adjacent to enemies.

units.name: Veil
units.prompt: Cloak and move behind enemy lines. Target isolated enemies with shadow_strike. Save breach for the most dangerous enemy. Avoid being caught uncloaked.

units.name: Viper
units.prompt: Trap the paths enemies must take to reach your backline. Stay at medium range. Use pulse on clustered enemies. Denial blocks adjacent threats.

units.name: Veil
units.prompt: Cloak immediately on turn 1. Move toward the enemy medic or weakest target. Use shadow_strike when adjacent while cloaked. Use breach to sabotage high-value targets.

units.name: Deadeye
units.prompt: Stay at maximum range. Use precision_shot on the most wounded enemy to secure kills. If no one is wounded, target the enemy medic. Never move adjacent to enemies.

actions.thinking: Round 1, cloak immediately as instructed. Then move north toward enemy lines. Deadeye at (4,4) is the closest threat at dist=4. Moving to (4,3) gets me closer while staying cloaked. Cloak first, then advance.
Round 1 — cloak immediately as ordered. Then advance south toward enemies. Hawk is at (2,0) facing N, Lattice at (3,1) facing N. Move to (2,2) to close distance while cloaked.

Both enemies are out of range (dist 5 and 6). My max range is 2 tiles. I need to advance toward enemies while staying at max range. Moving to (2,2) gets me closer to both enemies. From (2,2), Viper at (1,4) is still dist 3, still out of range. Let me move as far forward as possible - (2,2) is the best move toward the enemies while staying away from adjacency. No shots available this turn.

No enemies in range from current position (4,4). Both Hawk at (2,0) dist=6 and Lattice at (3,1) dist=4 are out of my range-2. I need to close distance. Moving to (3,3) gets me closer to Lattice at dist=sqrt(0+4)=2, bringing Lattice into range. I must avoid moving adjacent to enemies. Lattice is a vector so I need to stay away from adjacent. At (3,3), Lattice at (3,1) is distance 2 — within precision_shot range and not adjacent. After moving to (3,3), I can use precision_shot on Lattice.

Enemies are at dist=5, out of range. I should move forward and place a trap on a likely approach path. Hawk at (2,0) and Lattice at (3,1) will likely advance north toward our backline. Moving to (2,3) puts me in a good central position. I'll place a trap at (3,2) to intercept Lattice's advance path.

Deadeye is 2 tiles away at (3,3) — within trap range. I can place a trap on (3,2) to block their advance south. Then move to (4,1) to reposition away from Viper while maintaining denial threat. Viper is at dist=3 so no adjacency block on trap placement.

Cloak expires after this turn. Deadeye is adjacent at (3,3) facing S. I can move to (3,4) to get behind Deadeye, then use breach to take control of them — they're the dangerous striker. Viper is 2 tiles away so won't block breach from (3,4).

Cloak has 1 turn remaining — must use it now. Lattice(vector) at (4,1) facing E has a reachable behind position at (3,1). Moving there puts me adjacent and behind for breach next turn. Avoid trap at (3,2). Move to (3,1) to get behind Lattice for breach next round. No ability this turn — breach cooldown ready but cloak expires after this turn, and breaching now would require being adjacent which I'm not yet.

Orders say to attack Viper at (2,3) next turn, so I need to set that up. But first, Veil(specter) is right at (3,4) distance 1 — I can hit it with precision_shot for 2dmg if I don't move first. I'm not adjacent to Lattice (3 tiles away, safe). Veil is within range 2. I should fire precision_shot at Veil first, then consider positioning. After shooting, I need to attack Viper next turn — Viper is at (2,3), currently an ally, so I need to be adjacent. I'm at (3,3), Viper is at (2,3) — already adjacent! So I can stay or move to maintain adjacency. Let me fire precision_shot at Veil (3,4) for 2dmg, then wait since I'm already adjacent to Viper for next turn's attack order.

No enemies are wounded, so I should target the enemy specter Veil at (3,1) which is in range at dist=2. I'm at full HP and don't need to move. I haven't moved this turn so precision_shot deals full 2dmg. Viper is not adjacent (dist=3) so no blocking. Wait as second action since I can deal damage without repositioning.

Veil(specter) is adjacent at (3,1) - my Denial passive blocks their cloak ability. I can pulse to hit them for 1dmg, or attack for 1dmg. Pulse hits all within 1 tile including allies - Hawk is at (2,0) which is distance >1 from me, so no friendly fire. Veil is at dist=1, so pulse hits them. After pulsing, I should place a trap at (3,2) to block the chokepoint - but wait, there's already a trap at (3,2). Instead I'll move to (4,2) to stay near the chokepoint and use pulse on Veil, then place a trap at (3,0) or another key tile. Actually, best play: pulse Veil for 1dmg now (they're adjacent), then move to maintain denial pressure. Or move first to (3,0) to get between enemies... No - Veil is at (3,1) adjacent, I should exploit that. Use pulse first (hits Veil at dist=1), then place a trap at a chokepoint tile like (4,2) to cover the flank. Trap range is ≤2 tiles from current position - (4,2) is dist=1, valid. This controls the eastern approach.

Veil(specter) is at (3,4), distance 2 and in range. I can pulse from my current position (2,3) to hit Veil at (3,4) — but pulse hits ALL units within 1 tile, and my ally Deadeye is at (3,3) which is adjacent to me, so pulse would damage them too. Better to trap instead. There's already a trap at (3,2). I should place a trap on a likely approach path. Veil at (3,4) is north of me and approaching south. If I move to (2,4), I get closer to Veil and can trap (3,4) or (3,5) to cut off their path. Actually, Veil is already at (3,4) so trapping there is invalid. I can trap (2,4) or (3,5) to block escape routes. Let me move to (2,4) to stay at medium range and place a trap at (3,5) to cut off Veil's retreat northward, or I can trap (2,2) to cover Hawk's approach. Hawk is at (2,0) moving north — trapping (2,1) or (2,2) would intercept. I can reach (2,2) with a move. Best plan: move to (2,2) to approach Hawk's path, then trap (2,1) to intercept Hawk coming north.

I'm at (3,1) adjacent to Lattice at (4,1) whose denial zone blocks my cloak/breach. I'm already behind Lattice (facing E, I'm to its west). I have 2HP so I need to be careful. Lattice denial blocks special abilities but NOT basic attack. I can attack Lattice for 1 damage. After attacking, I should move away to avoid being killed — move to (3,0) to get distance from Lattice and closer to Hawk at (2,0). Actually, let me attack first then move to safety.

I'm already at (3,4) which is directly behind Deadeye at (3,3) who faces S. Breach is on cooldown (1 turn remaining), so I can't use it. Shadow_strike works at adjacent range and doesn't break cloak — but I'm not cloaked. I can use shadow_strike on Deadeye at (3,3) since I'm adjacent. This deals 1 damage and I can still move. After attacking, I should reposition to avoid counterattack. Moving to (4,4) or (4,5) keeps me at distance from Viper (who is at (2,2), 3 tiles away — safe). I'll shadow_strike Deadeye first, then move to (4,4) to create separation.

Enemy Veil (specter) is wounded and only 1 tile away at (3,0). Priority is to secure the kill with precision_shot. I'm not adjacent to Viper (dist=2), so precision_shot is not blocked. I haven't moved, so full 2dmg applies. Veil is wounded — this should finish them. Stay in place and shoot.

I have orders to attack Viper at (2,3) next turn, so I need to position for that. Enemy Veil(specter) is at (4,4), dist 2, in range. I'm at (3,3) with 3HP. I should shoot Veil with precision_shot (2dmg) now since it's in range, then move to (2,3) to set up the Viper attack next turn. Wait - orders say attack Viper NEXT turn, meaning I should position now. Moving to (2,3) puts me adjacent to the trap at (2,1) area but (2,3) itself is clear. If I move first to (2,3), precision_shot does only 1dmg since I moved. Better to shoot Veil first (2dmg, no move penalty), then move to (2,3) to be in position. Lattice is at (4,1), dist 3 - not adjacent so no blocking. Veil at (4,4) has LoS from (3,3). Fire precision_shot at Veil, then move to (2,3).

Hawk is at (2,0), dist=2 and in range. There's already a trap at (2,1) blocking that path. I should place another trap to further deny Hawk's approach routes. (3,1) is a valid move tile and would let me place a trap on a path Lattice might use. But better: I'm at (2,2), Hawk is at (2,0) with trap at (2,1) already blocking direct path. I can attack Hawk directly from here (dist=2, range=2). Then move away from the trap at (2,1). Let me attack Hawk first, then place a trap on (3,1) or move. Actually: attack Hawk (in range), then place a trap somewhere useful. Trap at (3,2) already exists. Valid trap targets within range 2 from (2,2): need empty tiles. (1,1), (1,3), (3,3) could work. (3,3) blocks approach from Veil's direction. I'll attack Hawk then trap (3,3).

Veil (specter) is critical at (3,0) and within range 2. I can attack it now to finish it off. There's a trap at (4,2) and (3,2). Viper is 3 tiles away so no denial risk at current position. Priority: eliminate the critical Veil with attack, then place a trap to control the approach path from Viper/Deadeye coming from (2,2)/(2,3). Move to (3,1) to get adjacent to Veil at (3,0) for the attack, then trap (3,2) to block the corridor — but (3,2) already has a trap. Better: attack Veil from current position (dist=2, range=2 for attack? No — attack is adjacent only, range=adjacent). I need to move adjacent to Veil. Veil is at (3,0), so move to (3,1) puts me adjacent. Then attack to finish critical Veil. Alternatively, pulse only hits within 1 tile. Trap range is ≤2 tiles. I can place a trap at (3,0) if Veil moves or use trap on an approach tile. Actually, Veil is at (3,0) dist=2 — I can place trap ON (3,0) to damage Veil? No, trap goes on empty tile. I can move to (4,0) which is valid, then I'm adjacent to Veil at (3,0) dist=1, and can attack. Move to (4,0), attack Veil at (3,0) to eliminate the critical unit.

I'm at (4,4) with 2HP, uncloaked. Deadeye is at (2,3) facing W, and (3,3) is directly behind them and reachable in 1 tile from (3,3). I can move to (3,3) which puts me behind Deadeye. From there I can use breach to take control of Deadeye (the dangerous striker). Breach cooldown is ready and this is a high-value target. Move to (3,3) first, then breach Deadeye.

secondAction.addendum: Move away from Viper, toward allied units at (2,0)

actions.thinking: Both enemies are healthy, so no wounded target to prioritize. No enemy medic present. Viper is at dist=2 (in range), Deadeye is at dist=3 (out of precision_shot range of ≤2). I must not move adjacent to Viper. Current position (2,0) gives range=2 to Viper — perfect for precision_shot. I should NOT move (moving would reduce precision_shot to 1dmg and risks getting closer to Viper). Fire precision_shot on Viper from current position.

Orders say move away from Viper (at 2,2) and toward allied units at (2,0). Veil is adjacent and critical - I can finish it with precision_shot before moving. Moving to (2,1) would be toward (2,0) but there's a trap there. Best move toward (2,0) area is (1,2) or stay and shoot Veil first. Shoot Veil with precision_shot (dist=1, in range, 2dmg would finish a critical unit), then move toward (2,0). Valid move tiles include (1,2) which gets me closer to (2,0) and away from Viper.

Traps at (3,2) and (4,2) already cover the center approach. Enemies are at (2,2) and (1,2), distance 4-5. I should move forward to (4,1) to get closer and place a trap at (3,1) to extend the denial zone southward, creating a trap corridor that funnels enemies. Moving to (4,1) first, then trap at (3,1) to block the approach path between the existing traps and my allies at (2,0).

Hawk is at (2,0), dist=2 and in range. There's already a trap at (2,1) blocking the direct path north. I should attack Hawk directly since they're in range. Then I can place a trap at (3,1) to cover the eastern approach and cut off Lattice's path. Staying at (2,2) keeps me away from Lattice's denial range.

Both enemies are healthy, so no wounded targets to finish off. No enemy medic present. Viper is at distance 2 - I can precision_shot from current position without moving adjacent. Deadeye is at distance 3 which is out of precision_shot range (max 2). I'll fire precision_shot at Viper since they're in range and I shouldn't move (staying at max range per orders). No movement needed - current position is safe and optimal.

Orders say move away from Viper (at 2,2) and toward allied units at (2,0). Hawk is at (2,0) - that's an enemy, but orders say move toward (2,0). Valid moves include (1,1) and (1,0) which move me south toward (2,0) while staying away from Viper at (2,2). Moving to (1,1) gets me closer to (2,0) and away from Viper. From (1,1) I can then try precision_shot on Hawk at (2,0) - dist would be ~2 tiles, within range. Let me move to (1,1) first, then shoot Hawk.

Hawk is at (2,0), distance 2 — in attack range. I'm at (2,2). There's already a trap at (2,1) between us, so Hawk will take damage if they advance. I should attack Hawk directly since they're in range. Lattice is at dist 3, not a threat yet. I'll attack Hawk then hold position — no need to move into trap territory.

I'm at (4,1) with traps already at (3,2), (4,2), and (3,1). Enemies Viper and Deadeye are at dist=3. I need to control the approach corridor. Moving to (5,2) puts me in a flanking position and I can place a trap at (5,1) to cover another approach vector. Alternatively, I can move to (4,0) and trap (5,1) to create a wider net. Looking at the trap cluster around (3,1)-(4,2), I should extend coverage westward toward enemy positions. Move to (3,0) to get closer and place a trap at (2,1) which is directly in the path between enemies and my ally Hawk at (2,0). This creates a trap right next to Hawk's position that enemies must step through.

Orders say move away from Viper (at 2,2) toward allied units at (2,0). I'm at (1,1). Moving to (1,0) gets me closer to Hawk at (2,0) and away from Viper. From (1,0) I can fire precision_shot at Hawk (dist=2, no movement penalty if I shoot after moving to (1,0) — wait, I moved so it's 1dmg). Actually move to (2,1) is a trap. Move to (1,0) puts me dist=2 from Hawk — but I moved so precision_shot does 1dmg. Still worth it. Lattice is at (3,0), dist from (1,0) would be 2 — not adjacent so no denial. Fire precision_shot at Hawk.

I'm at (2,0) with 2HP. Deadeye is adjacent at (1,0) — that's a priority threat and an easy target. Viper is at (2,2), distance 2. I need to avoid moving adjacent to Viper (which would block precision_shot). Deadeye is adjacent to me, but precision_shot requires range ≤2 tiles and needs LoS — adjacent is within range 2. However, the WARNING says precision_shot is blocked when adjacent to enemy Vector, not striker. Deadeye is a striker, so precision_shot should work on Deadeye at dist=1. But if I move first, precision_shot does only 1dmg. Better to shoot first (2dmg) then move away. Shooting Deadeye at dist=1 with precision_shot = 2dmg, which would finish a 4HP enemy only if they're at 2HP or less — they're healthy (4HP), so 2dmg brings them to 2HP. Alternatively shoot Viper at dist=2 for 2dmg. Orders say target most wounded — both are healthy. No medic present. I'll shoot Deadeye (closer threat, could use suppressing_fire on Viper to slow them). Actually, let me use precision_shot on Deadeye (2dmg), then move away from Deadeye to safety. Moving to (4,0) gets me away from Deadeye and keeps distance from Viper (who is at (2,2), dist from (4,0) = ~2.8). Valid move tiles include (4,0).

Enemies are at dist 3-4, out of range. Traps already at (3,2), (2,1), (3,1) covering key paths. Lattice is at (3,0) heading toward our backline where Deadeye is at (1,0). I need to place a trap to intercept enemy advance. Moving to (1,2) keeps me away from Lattice's denial range while positioning me to pulse if they close in. Then place a trap at (2,0) to protect Deadeye's flank - enemies coming from (3,0) or (4,0) would need to pass through that corridor.

Deadeye is wounded and only 2 tiles away at (1,0). I can't attack at range 2 directly (attack is adjacent only), but I can move closer and attack, or use pulse if I get within 1 tile. Traps at (3,1) and (2,1) already cover approach paths. Viper is at dist 4, not a threat this turn. Best move: step to (2,0) to get adjacent to Deadeye, then attack for 1 damage on wounded target. This also puts me in denial range if Deadeye tries abilities.

I'm at 1HP and adjacent to Lattice (vector with DENIAL zone) which blocks my precision_shot. I need to move away from Lattice first. Valid moves: (0,0), (0,1), (1,1), (2,1) has a trap, (3,0). I should move to (3,0) to close range on Hawk (wounded) and escape Lattice's denial zone. From (3,0) Hawk is at dist=1 (adjacent) — that means I can't use precision_shot. Better to move to (0,1) or (1,1) to escape denial, but those don't bring Hawk in range either. Actually (3,0) is adjacent to Hawk at (4,0) which means precision_shot would still be blocked by adjacency rule. Let me reconsider — move to (0,1) to escape Lattice's denial, then I'm still not in range of Hawk. With only 1HP I'm nearly dead. Moving away from danger is priority. Go to (0,1) to escape denial zone, then wait since Hawk is out of range regardless.

Both enemies are at distance 5, out of my range 2. I need to close distance. Deadeye is critical HP - priority target. Moving to (5,1) gets me closer but still not in range. Best move is toward enemies. (3,0) reduces distance to Deadeye at (0,1) to dist=3, still out of range 2. Need to move twice to close. Move to (3,0) first - that puts Deadeye at distance sqrt(9+1)=3.16, still out. Trap at (3,1) and (2,1) block some paths. Moving to (5,1) keeps distance. Let me recalculate: from (3,0) to Deadeye (0,1): dx=3,dy=1, Chebyshev=3, still out of range 2. No position in valid moves gets me within range 2 of either enemy. Best to advance toward Deadeye. Move to (3,0) to close distance while avoiding traps.

I'm at (2,0), enemies are 3 tiles away. I have traps at (3,2),(4,2),(3,1),(2,1) already placed. I need to extend the trap zone to block enemy approach paths. Viper is at (1,2) moving west, Deadeye at (0,1). I should move to (1,1) to place a trap at (1,0) or somewhere that blocks their advance, but (2,1) already has a trap. Moving to (1,1) would be adjacent to Viper's denial zone (dist from Viper would be ~1-2 tiles). Let me check: Viper at (1,2), if I move to (1,1) that's distance 1 — too close, denial zone blocks trap. Better to move to (2,1)... but that has a trap. Move to (1,0) first (valid from move list? No — (1,0) not listed). Valid moves: (0,0),(1,0),(1,1),(2,1),(2,2),(3,1),(4,0). Wait, (2,1) has a trap — stepping on it would hurt me. I should avoid (2,1),(3,1). Safe valid moves: (0,0),(1,0),(1,1),(2,2),(4,0). If I move to (1,0), I can try to place a trap to cover the gap at (0,0) or (1,1). But at (1,0), Viper at (1,2) is distance 2 — denial range is adjacent only, so I'm safe. I can place trap at (1,1) from (1,0) to block approach. This creates a trap corridor.

Lattice is at (1,0), distance 2 — within my attack range but I must stay non-adjacent to avoid Denial blocking my trap ability. Deadeye is critical at (0,1) and needs protection. Traps already placed at (2,1) and (3,1) and (3,2). Lattice is approaching from (1,0) — I should trap the path between us. Moving to (2,2) keeps distance from Lattice while I place a trap at (1,1) to intercept Lattice's advance toward Deadeye. This protects the backline without getting adjacent to Lattice.

I'm at (3,0) with 2HP. Deadeye is critical at (0,1) but out of range at dist=4. Viper is healthy at (2,2) at dist=3, which is in range but >2 tiles so precision_shot won't reach (range ≤2). My only in-range target is Viper at dist=3, but precision_shot requires ≤2 tiles. I need to close distance to get Deadeye or Viper in range, but must not go adjacent to Viper. Moving to (4,0) keeps me away from Viper and Deadeye. From (4,0), Viper is at dist=sqrt(4+4)≈2.83, still out of precision_shot range. Moving to (2,0) would put me dist=2 from Viper at (2,2) — that's in range for precision_shot but I need LoS. From (2,0), Viper at (2,2) is 2 tiles north — valid LoS, dist=2, not adjacent. But (2,1) is a trap. Let me check: precision_shot from (2,0) to Viper at (2,2) — dist=2, in range. Viper is healthy so not the priority. Deadeye is critical at (0,1), dist from (2,0) = sqrt(4+1)≈2.24, out of range. Best play: move to (4,0) to stay safe, then wait — no valid precision_shot targets in range from current position (3,0) either. Actually from current (3,0), Viper at (2,2) is dist=sqrt(1+4)≈2.24 which is >2, out of precision_shot range. No valid ability targets. I should move toward Deadeye to get in range next turn without going adjacent to Viper. Move to (2,0): dist to Viper=(2,2) is 2 tiles, in precision_shot range, not adjacent. But I moved, so precision_shot does 1dmg. Still worth it against a healthy Viper.

I'm at (0,1) with 1HP - critically wounded. Hawk is wounded at (2,0), dist=3. Lattice is at (1,0), dist=2. I need to shoot Hawk to secure the kill. Lattice is a vector at (1,0) - I must not move adjacent to Lattice. My current position (0,1) is not adjacent to Lattice (1,0) - distance is sqrt(1+1)=1.4, actually that's diagonal which counts as adjacent! Wait, (0,1) to (1,0) is 1 tile diagonally. I need to check if this blocks precision_shot. The caution says Lattice is 2 tiles away, so I'm safe at current position. Hawk is wounded and in range at dist=3 - precision_shot has range ≤2 tiles so Hawk at dist=3 is actually OUT of precision_shot range. But the recon says Hawk is inRange... let me use suppressing_fire or attack. Actually recon says both are inRange from current position. Precision_shot range is ≤2 tiles. Hawk is dist=3, so NOT in precision_shot range. Lattice is dist=2, in range. But orders say target most wounded enemy. I should move closer to Hawk but can't go adjacent to Lattice. Move to (0,0) puts me dist=2 from Hawk and dist=1 from Lattice (adjacent - blocked). Move to (0,2) keeps distance. Actually wait - valid moves include (1,2) which puts me dist=2 from Hawk at (2,0) and dist=2 from Lattice at (1,0). From (1,2): to Hawk(2,0) = sqrt(1+4)=2.2, dist=3 in Manhattan. Hmm. Let me use Manhattan: from (1,2) to (2,0) = |1|+|2|=3. Still out of range. I can't reach range-2 of Hawk without getting adjacent to Lattice. Best option: shoot Lattice with precision_shot (dist=2, in range) since Hawk is out of precision_shot range. Or wait - I'm at 1HP, staying put and shooting Lattice.

Deadeye is critical and only 2 tiles away at (0,1). I can pulse from (1,0) to hit adjacent tiles within 1 tile — Deadeye at (0,1) is distance 2, outside pulse range. I need to move closer. Moving to (0,0) puts me adjacent to Deadeye at (0,1), then I can pulse to finish them. Viper is at dist 3 so no denial risk. Traps are blocking (1,1) and (2,1) so movement is limited. Valid moves include (0,0). Move to (0,0), then pulse — Deadeye at (0,1) would be 1 tile away, within pulse AoE.

Hawk is wounded at (2,0), distance 2, within my attack range. I should attack to finish them off or deal more damage. Traps at (3,2), (2,1), (3,1), (1,1) already cover many approach paths. I'm at (2,2) with Hawk directly south at (2,0). Attack Hawk directly since they're in range. Then consider positioning - staying at current position keeps denial pressure relevant if enemies close in.

Viper is at (2,2), distance 2 from my position (2,0). I have a clear shot with precision_shot. I haven't moved yet, so I'll get full 2dmg. Staying at current position maintains maximum range and avoids moving adjacent to Viper.

I'm at (0,0) with 6/9 HP. Viper is at (2,2) wounded, dist=4, out of range. There are already many traps at (3,2),(4,2),(3,1),(2,1),(1,1). Valid moves include (1,0) and (1,1) but (1,1) has a trap - avoid it. I should move toward Viper to get in range, but also place traps to control approach paths. Moving to (1,0) keeps me safe and positions me closer. From (1,0) I can potentially place a trap at (1,1) - wait that already has a trap. I could place at (0,1) or (0,2) to block western flank, or move to (0,1) then trap somewhere useful. Let me move to (0,2) via (0,1) - valid moves show (0,1) and (0,2) are reachable. Moving to (0,2) gets me closer to Viper's position. From there I can trap to control the area. Actually, I should place a trap on an empty tile within range 2 of current position. From (0,0), I can trap tiles within 2 distance that are empty. (0,1) is empty, (0,2) is empty, (1,0) is empty. The chokepoint between me and Viper would be around (1,1) but that's trapped. Let me move to (1,0) first, then place a trap at (2,0) or nearby to block Hawk's flank from Viper approach.

Hawk is wounded at (2,0), distance 2 — within attack range. I'm at (2,2). There are already traps at (2,1) and (3,1). Hawk is moving west, likely trying to flank. I can attack Hawk directly from here for 1dmg. Lattice is at (1,0) dist 3, out of denial range. I should place a trap to cut off Lattice's advance path, or attack the wounded Hawk to finish them. Attacking Hawk at (2,0) is the priority — they're wounded and in range. After attacking, I can stay put or reposition slightly. Moving to (3,3) keeps distance from Lattice while maintaining area control, but attacking now is better. I'll attack Hawk at (2,0) first, then place a trap on a likely approach path like (1,2) to deny Lattice movement options.
Viper is wounded at (2,2), distance 2 — exactly in range for precision_shot. I haven't moved yet so full 2dmg applies. This could finish off a wounded enemy. Stay at (2,0), no movement needed.

Hawk is wounded at (2,0), distance 2 and in range. I can attack for 1dmg. Traps are already covering (2,1) and (3,1) blocking direct paths. Lattice is at dist 3 so no denial threat yet. Priority: attack Hawk to finish or weaken further, then move away from Lattice's approach. Attacking from current position (2,2) hits Hawk at (2,0). After attack, I should reposition - moving to (4,2) keeps distance from Lattice at (1,0) and maintains medium range. Avoid (2,1),(3,1),(3,2),(1,1),(1,2) - all trapped.

Viper is at (4,2), dist=5, out of range. Traps already cover (3,2),(3,1),(2,1),(1,1),(0,1) — the chokepoint row is saturated. Hawk is at (2,0) wounded. I should move toward (3,0) to close distance and support Hawk, then place a trap at an uncovered tile if possible. (3,0) is in valid moves and extends my denial range eastward. From (3,0) I can trap (3,1) — already trapped. Check: (4,0) not in trap list, but range from (3,0) to (4,0) is 1 tile, valid. Actually my range is ≤2 tiles for trap. But I need to check if I'd be adjacent to Viper after move — Viper is at (4,2), so (3,0) to (4,2) is dist ~2.2, not adjacent. Trap at (4,0) would block Viper's southern approach. Move to (3,0), trap (4,0).

Viper is at (4,2), dist 4, out of range. I need to close distance. Valid moves include (4,0) but that's a trap. Best safe move toward Viper: (2,2) gets me closer. Wait - valid moves show (2,2) is available. From (2,2), dist to (4,2) would be 2 - in range for precision_shot. Move to (2,2), then precision_shot Viper.

Viper is critical at (4,2) and 3 tiles away. I have traps at (3,2), (3,1), (4,0) already placed. (4,1) is uncovered and sits between my current position and Viper. If I move to (4,1) I'd be adjacent to Viper and get denial blocked. Instead, move to (5,0) to stay away from denial range, then place a trap at (4,1) to cover the approach path toward our allies. Wait - (4,1) is in valid moves which means I can reach it but it's adjacent to Viper at (4,2), so trap would be blocked there. Let me move to (5,0) first, then from (5,0) I can trap (4,1) which is within 2 tiles and not blocked since I won't be adjacent to Viper. Actually from (5,0), Viper is at (4,2) - distance is |5-4|+|0-2|=3, not adjacent. So trap at (4,1) should work from (5,0).

I'm at (4,2) with 2HP - critically low. Hawk is wounded at (2,2) dist=2, in range. Lattice is at (5,0) dist=3. The area around (2,2) has many traps already placed. I need to finish off Hawk who is wounded. I can use pulse to hit Hawk (dist=2 from me, but pulse only hits within 1 tile). Hawk is at dist=2 so pulse won't reach. I can use attack on Hawk at dist=2 - but attack is adjacent only. I need to move closer. If I move to (3,2) - but that has a trap! Valid moves show (3,2) is valid... wait, traps are at (3,2),(2,1),(3,1),(1,1),(1,2). Moving to (3,2) would trigger the trap for 2dmg and I only have 2HP - that would kill me. Move to (4,1) instead to avoid traps, then use attack won't reach Hawk at (2,2) from (4,1) dist=3. Use pulse from (4,1) - Hawk at (2,2) is dist=3, still out of pulse range. Best option: move to (3,3) to avoid traps, then use attack - Hawk at dist still 2. I can't reach Hawk safely. Place a trap at (3,2) to catch Hawk if they advance - wait, (3,2) already has a trap. Move to (4,3) to stay safe and place a trap to block Lattice's advance path.

Viper is at critical HP and in range at dist=3. I'm at (2,2), Viper at (4,3). Precision shot has range ≤2 tiles, so dist=3 is out of range for precision_shot. I need to move closer but not adjacent. Moving to (3,2) brings me to dist=2 from Viper (4,3) — that's adjacent diagonal, actual distance = max(1,1)=1 tile Chebyshev or sqrt(2) Euclidean. Wait — (3,2) to (4,3): delta x=1, delta y=1, so dist=2 tiles Manhattan. That puts Viper in precision_shot range. But (3,2) is a trap! Check valid moves: (3,3) is available. From (3,3) to (4,3): dist=1 — that's adjacent, which blocks precision_shot due to Vector denial. From (2,3) to (4,3): delta x=2, delta y=0, dist=2 Manhattan — in range for precision_shot, not adjacent. But wait, Viper is vector with denial range adjacent — I need to NOT be adjacent. (2,3) to (4,3) dist=2, not adjacent. That works! Or (3,2) is listed as a trap but also in valid moves... I'll use (2,3) which avoids traps and keeps distance=2. Precision shot from (2,3) to (4,3): dist=2, in range, not adjacent to Viper. I moved so only 1dmg, but Viper is critical so should finish them.

Viper is at (4,3) critical health, dist=4. I'm at (5,0). (4,0) already has a trap. I can move to (5,1) or (5,2) to get closer and place a trap to cut off Viper's path. Moving to (5,2) gets me within range 2 of Viper at (4,3) - dist would be sqrt(1+1)=~1.4, so adjacent almost. Actually (5,2) to (4,3) is dist ~1.4, within range 2. I can place a trap at (4,2) or (5,3) to block Viper's movement south. Let me move to (5,1) first - that's a valid move tile - then trap at (5,2) or (4,1). Wait, (4,1) already has a trap. Move to (5,1), then place trap at (5,2) to create a barrier along the eastern edge blocking Viper.

Critical situation: 1HP remaining. Hawk is wounded at dist=2, in range for pulse (1 tile AoE won't reach dist=2). I need to survive. Moving to (5,3) puts me further from Hawk. I should use pulse if Hawk gets adjacent, but Hawk is at dist=2 so pulse won't hit. Best play: trap a tile Hawk must cross to reach me, then reposition. Hawk is at (2,3) moving toward me. If I stay at (4,3), Hawk could move to (3,3) then attack. I should move away to (5,4) to gain distance, and place a trap at (4,3) or on Hawk's approach path. Trap at (3,3) would catch Hawk moving toward me. But (3,2) is a valid move tile - trap range is ≤2 tiles from current pos (4,3), so (3,3) is within range. Place trap at (3,3) to block Hawk's approach, then move to (5,4) for safety.
